channel.title: Posts on Data Science in Education
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Data Science in Education

item.title: Mapping Statewide School Ratings with US Census Tracts
item.author: daniela@uoregon.edu (Daniel Anderson)
item.description: In this post, I’d like to share some work related to geo-spatial mapping, statewide school ratings, and US Census Bureau data using census tracts. Specifically, I wanted to investigate whether there was a relation between the median housing price in an area, and the statewide achievement ratings for schools in the corresponding area. There is a strong relation between socio-economic status and student achievement, but less is known about how statewide ratings for schools relate to the demographics of the corresponding area.

item.title: esvis: Part 1
item.author: daniela@uoregon.edu (Daniel Anderson)
item.description: This is the first of a series of posts to introduce my new esvis R package, why I think it’s important, and some of its capabilities. As of this writing the current version on CRAN is 0.0.1, so it’s obviously still fresh and may have some bugs. If you find any, please let me know. You can install the package like you would any other on R install.packages("esvis") or if you’d prefer the sometimes buggy but more feature-heavy development version, install from github with devtools.
